channel.description: Recent news, album release info, featured music, chart history, birthday nods and a few calls (when available) taken during the second half of the show with a surprise interview once in a blue moon. All dealing with 80s music and the artists (that released albums during the 1980s.) More info at Talking80sMusic.com and 80sMusicCentral.com. This Podcast was created using www.talkshoe.com

item.title: EPISODE208 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: Yes, the time has come. This is our last show and we will be cramming a lot in. We will fulfill two requests. We expect to focus on Erasure (we kinda focused more on their latest album previously) and play an Aerosmith retrospective mix. We'd also like to hear from as many of you -- our listeners -- as possible. The final hurrah!
item.itunes:author: An80sNut

item.title: EPISODE207 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: Our last pre-recorded episode, we plan to turn our attention on one of Martin's favorite acts... Depeche Mode. Expect a massive retrospective mix, a b-side and some other stuff. Happy new year!!

item.title: EPISODE205 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week, we focus on the shared story of Joy Division and New Order. Sure, you can separate the two but you'd wind up re-telling a lot of the same story. Expect retrospective mixes, a few stand-out tracks and more.

item.title: EPISODE204 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week we will focus on the career of late singer-songwriter Eddie Rabbitt. Expect a big, long retrospective mix as well as "Step By Step" and "She's Comin' Back To Say Goodbye." Major change to the show this week and a big announcement at the end of the show.

item.title: EPISODE202 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music, we take a look at Manchester rock act The Smiths and the later solo career of frontman Morrissey. It's a big story but we felt the two should be paired together. We play 2 retrospective mixes (one for each) as well as one other memorable song.

item.title: EPISODE201 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week we focus on the career of Welsh singer Bonnie Tyler. A chart phenomenon in the U.K yet for some reason her #1 hit here overshadowed the rest of her output. Expect a massive retrospective mix, a live hits medley, one hit you should know and a single you might have overlooked.

item.title: EPISODE200 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week, we hit the big 200 and celebrate it by talking with OMD's Andy McCluskey about their hits, the reunion and their new studio album, History Of Modern. Expect to hear a massive retrospective mix, "Of All The Things We've Made," a live version of "Enola Gay" and something off the new album.

item.title: EPISODE194 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week we turned our focus on late vocalist/guitarist Jeff Healey. Leading The Jeff Healey Band, the Canadian act sold millions of records, played thousands of shows and collaborated with some of the greats of rock and blues. We expect to play a retrospective mix and a few classic tracks during the show.

item.title: EPISODE187 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music, we will be going a little more modern rock as we talk about Coventry, England's The Primitives. Don't know them? We'll fix that... it's our job. Many U.K. hits that received a lot of airplay at college radio in the U.S. Expect to hear a retrospective mix as well as 3 select singles by this act.

item.title: EPISODE186 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: We interviewed Asia/Buggles member Geoff Downe a little over a year ago. We had promised then to focus on a related band. This week on Talking 80s Music, we make good on that promise as we turn our attention on... Yes. Expect a retrospective mix, "Tempus Fugit," "I'm Running" and a live version of "Leave It."

item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music, we turn our focus on one of the most unavoidable voices of the decade... the late Laura Branigan. item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week we will look at the short career of singer-songwriter (and later producer) Jon Astley. Expect to hear his singles ("Jane's Getting Serious" and "Put This Love To The Test") and "But Is It Commercial." Due to time conflict, this episode was pre-recorded.

item.title: EPISODE182 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music, we decided to talk about our third Beatle so far... the late George Harrison. From Beatles lead guitarist to solo hit-maker to Wilbury, Harrison touched many mediums and has an enduring legacy. Expect to hear a retrospective mix, Martin's favorite Harrison single ("All Those Years Ago") and the often skipped 1988 single "This Is Love."
item.itunes:author: An80sNut

item.title: EPISODE181 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: You've been wondering what's been going on with Irene Cara. She has a new double-CD on the way with her new act Hot Caramel. We'll be talking with her about the new single, "Kiss And Walk Away," as well as her earlier hits. Expect to hear the new song, a retrospective mix and "The Dream (Hold On To Your Dream)."

item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week we talk with Culture Club guitarist/keyboardist Roy Hay live and talk about his upcoming appearance with Boys Don't Cry & Friends on June 12th at The Canyon Club. We play a retrospective mix and live tracks ("I'm Afraid Of Me" and "Church Of The Poison Mind") as well as take a surprise call.

item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week, we will focus on one of the most dynamic voices of the decade... Gloria Estefan -- a true hit-making sound machine. We'll play an extensive retrospective mix, "Prisoner Of Love," a live version of "Falling In Love (Uh-Oh)" and an often overlooked soundtrack song.

item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music, we decided to take another listener request and focus on Scottish new wave act Aztec Camera and their principal singer-songwriter Roddy Frame. Expect a retrospective mix, live version of "Oblivious," their first single "Just Like Gold" and their later single, "The Crying Scene."

item.title: EPISODE174 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music, we focus on Texas singer-songwriter/guitarist Charlie Sexton. Releasing some of his earliest music at the age of 15, he would release his solo debut album two years later, become an in-demand session guitarist and, during the last few years, became Bob Dylan's guitarist. Expect to hear a few of his solo works.

item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music, we look at a short-lived pop act named Tight Fit. It's not often a band starts as a producer's project, scores a hit, changes all its member, scores a few more hits, changes all its members, doesn't chart and then re-emerges. Expect to hear samples from throughout their career.

item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music, we turn our focus on late teen icon Andy Gibb. We will share that story as well as feature a few of his singles.

item.description: It is with a heavy heart that we focus this week's episode of Talking 80s Music on Los Angeles-based rock act, The Knack. item.title: EPISODE159 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music, we will look to a little island called New Zealand and focus on a band called the Split Enz. Evolving from progressive rock to punk to pop, the band would have several hits before finding more success separately. Expect a retrospective mix, their rare single "No Exit" and a few other gems.

item.title: EPISODE158 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week, Talking 80s Music focused on the recent release of the Park Lane Archives. The compilation collects 22 demos and exclusive rarities from the Park Lane Studios in Glasgow Scotland -- which can be viewed as a historical record of the 'Scotrock' music scene. We feature songs by Bourgie Bourgie, the Jazzateers and the Kevin McDermott Orchestra.

item.title: EPISODE154 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music, we touched on one of the bigger teen heart-throbs of the 1980s... Corey Hart. Some great music came from the Canadian singer/songwriter but for some reason it never manifested overseas (i.e. England.) Expect a retrospective mix, an unplugged recording and a few other goodies. Oh, and there is the Corey Challenge and a preview of a new song by Keel.

item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music, we thought it was time to talk about one of the biggest icons of a single music genre. And they don't get any bigger than late reggae artist Bob Marley. Expect to hear a retrospective mix (focused on his last two albums), a live track recorded in 1980 and an unlikely posthumous collaboration.

item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music, you hear The Truth, the whole Truth and nothing but The Truth as we focused on the U.K. act of the same name. Expect a retrospective mix of some of their singles, "A Step In The Right Direction," "Weapons Of Love" and, the very hard to find theme from the film The Hidden, "It's Hidden" to cover the different phases of their career.

item.title: EPISODE143 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: It was a death that rocked the music world at the beginning of a new decade and ended a brilliant career short. This week on Talking 80s Music we turned an eye on John Lennon. His output during the 1980s was limited to two albums but he did have an affect on the music of the 80s and we will remind you how. We featured clips from one of his last interviews, a retrospective mix and demos of the songs "I'm Losing You" and "I'm Steppin' Out."

item.title: EPISODE138 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music we decided to do something unusual. We touched on the passing of writer/director/producer John Hughes during last week's episode. His films played a huge role in our perception of the 1980s and the soundtracks... well, we'll talk about how they relate to all seven of his directorial theatrical released of the decade. His films get a retrospective mix and we feature songs by Karla DeVito and Kirsty MacColl.

item.title: EPISODE137 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week we spent our second week in Germany to focus on synthpop/dance act Camouflage. It's easy to misunderstand a band once they have a big hit single. Some continue striving to create the same song over and over again to regain that ever elusive hit. Camouflage produced two strong albums during the 1980s and found themselves treading water as a duo only to reunite for some solid efforts recently. That is evidenced by our retrospective mix and we also featured a remix of "That Smiling Face," "Love Is A Shield" and "The Great Commandment 2001.) Believe the scholars, read the readings... they are worth investigating.

item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: We were planning to present a little more metal this week but, looked at the calendar, and decided to let Martin pick 3 personal favorites to feature this week on Talking 80s Music. It's his birthday the following day so expect to hear songs by Jules Shear, Rodger Hodgson and Marty Balin.

item.title: EPISODE134 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: Sometimes circumstances force us to veer from our schedule. But, we return to focus on Canadian rock/pop act The Payolas this week on Talking 80s Music. We plan to feature their most memorable hit (we shouldn't have to see it), "Never Said I Loved You" and their most recent single, "Shark Attack."

item.title: EPISODE133 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week we focused on Asia (the band, not the continent.) 'Supergroup' is a word that's tossed around a lot recently so why not look at one of the biggest during the early 1980s. We talked with keyboardist Geoff Downes about his career, the bands he's been with and the reunion of the original Asia. We featured a retrospective mix from the band as well as live versions of "Only Time Will Tell" and "The Smile Has Left Your Eyes."

item.title: EPISODE131 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week we were going to focus on the Payolas but as reports of Michael Jacksons passing arose... we had to rise to the occasion. We will feature a retrospective mix, live version of "Billie Jean" and his first U.K. #1 single.

item.title: EPISODE130 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music, we head to Switzerland to talk about the jazz/pop duo Double. Their hit single "Captain Of Her Heart" is possibly one of the most overlooked gems of the decade. We will remedy that, give you an overview of their career and talk about the latest releases.

item.description: Update episode... What? Well, sometimes we catch a few of our previously featured artists after we do a show about them. No music featured but we do talk with former Sheriff and current Alias guitarist Steve DeMarchi.

item.title: EPISODE128 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: We often look for balance while browsing our show archive. We felt that R&B needed to be shown some love this week on Talking 80s Music so we focused on The Jacksons. Sure, they had a healthy career before the 80s (as the Jackson 5) but if asked to name a few of their hits that decade, many would list ones by Michael. Expect a retrospective mix and "This Place Hotel" and "Nothing (That Compares 2 You)".

item.title: EPISODE127 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: We saw many charitable collaborations during the decade, this week on Talking 80s Music we focused on the often overlooked 1985 project, Hear 'N Aid, that raised over $1 million for famine relief in Africa. We plan to play their lengthy, "We're Stars," as well Y&T's "Go For The Throat" and a live version of Accept's "Up To The Limit."

item.title: EPISODE126 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: Back to a little more obscurity this week on Talking 80s Music as we focus on U.K. new romantic duo Seona Dancing. If you are scratching your head, it's alright. They only released a pair of singles but, as always, there's more to the story. We expect to play "More To Lose," "You're On My Side" and a remix of "Bitter Heart" during the show.

item.title: EPISODE125 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: There are few times that we try to hit you over the head with something you should know already. But we decided this week on Talking 80s Music to pay tribute to late legendary blues guitarist Stevie Ray Vaughan and feature a few live tracks recorded in late 1988.

item.description: This week we focused on another Australian act The Screaming Tribesmen. We played their "Igloo," "Living Vampire" and their sole U.S. hit "I Got A Feeling" as we talked about their career.

item.title: EPISODE123 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: Icehouse isn't a name that gets repeated often and you quite possibly might have missed their music entirely (if you were were sleepwalking through the decade), but with every album, their hits kept coming and charting more, higher and abroad. So, we hope to thaw your heart to a band -- you just might recognize once you hear them -- during the show this week on Talking 80s Music.

item.title: EPISODE122 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music,we felt that it was time to check your Metal Health. There isn't anyone that that phrase is more connected to than Quiet Riot. (Rightly so as they were the first heavy metal band to have a top 5 hit and #1 album during the same week.) We will feature a retrospective mix, "Party All Night" and "Run For Cover" recorded live in 1984 and "Stay With Me Tonight."

item.title: EPISODE121 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music,we will turn our spotlight on Utopia... no, not the place. We will feature the power-pop band in a retrospective mix as well as their singles "Crybaby" and "Feet Don't Fail Me Now." Also notable for Las Vegas listeners/readers: We are giving away tickets to the Rick Springfield, John Waite, Lou Gramm and Eddie Money concert on Apr. 25th via the show and newsletter this week. So keep your eyes open. (Must be available to attend the show to enter.)

item.title: EPISODE120 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: On Mar. 25th we (the music community) lost an impact artist -- someone who affected the music charts in the 1970s and 1980s. This week on Talking 80s Music, we focused our attention to the music and career of Dan Seals and do our best to pay tribute to an often overlooked crossover artist. We featured a retrospective mix, "My Old Yellow Car," "One Friend," "Love On Arrival" and an interview with him recorded in 1990. We also took calls from Aaron and Ben.

item.title: EPISODE119 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: The sounds of industrial music... we haven't really talked that much about the genre in the last two years but this week we correct that. We will discuss the new documentary, Metal Machine Music: Nine Inch Nails And The Industrial Uprising, as well as feature a few tracks by trail blazers Throbbing Gristle, Einsturzende Neubauten and Cabaret Voltaire.

item.title: EPISODE118 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week we check in with the Dream Weaver himself, Gary Wright. We will chat about his hits, his sound and a little about his work during the 1980s and now. We will also feature a retrospective mix and samples of songs (the new version of "Love Is Alive" and "Silent Choirs Of Snowflakes") off his latest EPs -- The Light Of A Million Suns and Waiting To Catch The Light.

item.title: EPISODE117 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: In the final episode of our 3-show run discussing the branches formed by Sheriff, we discuss the other 40% (Curci/DeMarchi) that joined former members of Heart to form Alias. We will play a few songs of their debut album as well as a sample or two from their long-awaited sophomore effort, Never Say Never.

item.title: EPISODE116 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: In our 2nd of 3 episodes talking about the splinter groups of Sheriff, we focus this week on the 40% of the band that formed Frozen Ghost. More successful in Canada, the duo of Lanni and Hassel scored a U.S. hit with "Should I See" from their debut album. Expect to hear that, "Beware The Masque," "Dream Come True" and a live version of "Promises."

item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week, we start a 3-week run discussing U.S. chart-topping Canadian act Sheriff and the groups they formed after they split up. We expect to play several live tracks recorded in 1983 ("California," "Living For A Dream," "You Remind Me" and "When I'm With You."

item.title: EPISODE113 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music we decided to focus on Sonic Youth's guitarist/singer/songwriter Thurston Moore. We don't expect to go into the band's entire history or their Ciccone Youth side-project but focus on Moore's solo work and feature "Frozen Gtr" and "Fri/End" from his 2007 album, Trees Outside The Academy. We also tried to make up for not taking callers for awhile and jammed 4 in this longer than normal episode.

item.title: EPISODE112 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week's episode of Talking 80s Music falls on St. Valentine's Day. We originally had another featured act planned but postponed it to bring you something more appropriate for the holiday... Heart. We expect to talk about their history, recording career and latest album as well as feature one of our retrospective mixes, "Shell Shock" and "Wild Child (live)".

This week we featured music ("You Know That I Love You," "Winning" and "Hold On") by Santana from the chapter of their career that often gets bypassed, the 80s.

item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week we talked with Boys Don't Cry vocalist Nick Richards about the band, their history, their White Punks On Rap collection and next album. We also featured their classic hit, "I Wanna Be A Cowboy," as well as premiered new material ("Don't Go Jumping With Frogs" and "Blow Me.")

item.title: EPISODE109 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: Ever heard of the Rembrandts? No they aren't an 80s act. But half the duo, Danny Wilde, was. Wilde will be our featured artist this week and we expect to play his 1986 hit songs ("Isn't It Enough" and "Body To Body") as well as "Like A River" and possibly "California Sunshine."

item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week a friend's request gets answered as we feature music ("Sunday Morning," "T.V. Man," "A Way" and "Billie Jean/Take Me To The River (live)) by The Bolshoi. Again, one of those bands that was appreciated by the critics and fans but didn't make that jump into mainstream stardom.

item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: We really didn't plan too far ahead for this week's episode of Talking 80s Music. We were still drinking the eggnog but in a moment of sobriety the thought of talking about record label rollercoasters came up. So this week we will feature music ("Somewhere In The Night," "Hungry Stranger" and their hit "What Do All The People Know") from The Monroes' 1982 self-titled EP.

Think Living Color but a grittier.

item.title: EPISODE104 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music we will celebrate the life of Johann (Hans) Holzel during the 10th anniversary of his passing. Better known under the name Falco, he blazed a trail with international hits that fused dance, rock and rap as well as mixed the English and German languages. Expect a retrospective mix, a remix of "Coming Home (Jeanny Part 2)," a wild mix of "Vienna Calling (live)" and "Out Of The Dark."

item.title: EPISODE102 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week we feature music ("Isolation," "Dark Age" and "Last Chance") by Neon from their recently released collection, Memories: 1980-1986. We also go through a humongous list of Grammy Award nominees which should remind people how relevant 80s artists are.

item.title: EPISODE101 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: How do you follow an episode that marks a milestone for our series? Probably with a trio that released 8 albums during the 1980s and are still going strong. Feel the tension... wait for it... this week we talk to and feature music from Alvin And The Chipmunks who have released their new album, Undeniable.

item.title: EPISODE100 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: Celebrating our 100th episode, a lot of things came together during the week. We interview former Madam X/Vixen drummer Roxy Petrucci and feature a few songs that she had to have broken a stick or two on. We talk to Patrick from 80sAirwaves.com who gave Martin his recording launchpad. Lastly, we feature a previously-unreleased demo from Buzz that has some strange origin. All that plus your regular news and information about your favorite recording artists.

item.title: EPISODE97 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This show falls on the day after Halloween. Of course, we are big fans of the holiday but next year the show lands right on it which made us think that we could push back the scary episode. It must be fate as we were itching to get our classic rock groove on with an AC/DC retrospective mix, "You Shook Me All Night Long" (live) and "Who Made Who" as well as "Money Made" off their new studio album, Black Ice, and our standard babble.

item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week on Talking 80s Music, we have our first two-fer episode. We will feature music by Juliana Hatfield ("Shining On" and "This Lonely Love" featuring Richard Butler) and Curiosity Killed The Cat ("Misfit" and "Name And Number" by Element vs Ben VP.) 2 different countries, 2 different styles and for some reason we just couldn't say no to a possible trainwreck.

item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com

Feel free to prime yourself by listening to episode 34 (on which we featured Dr. Robert's solo work.)

item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: We haven't really focused much on female vocalists or country artists during our previous 85 shows... so this week we combine them. We plan to feature songs ("Too Many Lovers," "Baby, What About You," "The Sound Of Goodbye" and "Straight To The Heart") from each of the 4 sets during this episode.

item.title: EPISODE83 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: It isn't often that the show falls on Martin's birthday. We set a record number for calls but most of them were from his family. We also played songs by Mondo Rock ("Primitive Love Rites",) Thelonious Monster ("So What If I Did",) Coldcut ("Stop This Crazy Thing",) Britny Fox ("Girlschool") and a last minute Depeche Mode ("Pleasure Little Treasure".) Sadly, we had some technical difficulty early on with our call from Stacy as it seemed to have overlapped with our news segment and left a gap afterward. Very odd. We'll be watching that in the future.
item.itunes:author: An80sNut

item.title: EPISODE82 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week we featured music ("I Want To Be Free," "The Vow," "Don't Fall In Love (I Said)" and "Echo Beach") from Good Morning Universe: The Best Of Toyah. She didn't find the same success here in the U.S. as in the U.K. but is still worth investigating for the 80s music obsessed. We also mentioned the call-in marathon planned for next week.

item.title: EPISODE80 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week we will feature songs ("Appetite," "When Love Breaks Down," "Faron Young" and "If You Don't Love Me") from the 39-track double-disc collection Kings Of Rock And Roll: The Best Of Prefab Sprout. For some reason their song-craft never caught on in the States but well worth your investigating. (Heck, Thomas Dolby produced one of their albums.) Should also be a longer episode this week as we make things more current... meaning we have 4 more days of news to squeeze in.

item.title: EPISODE70 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week we do something completely different. We will be focusing on a prominent disease that is inextricably tied to the decade... AIDS. We will be talking to a fellow 80s fan, Danielle, who will be participating in the AIDS Walk of New York 2008 on May 18th. We plan to sponsor her walk and, if you would like to do the same, more information will be given during the show. We will feature music by several artists that lost their battles with the disease.

item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com

item.title: EPISODE62 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: A 2-hour episode this week as we feature a hit mix, "Love Will Tear Us Apart," "Tomb Of Memories" and "Iron Out The Rough Spots" from the double-CD Demon Music Group compilation, Wherever I Lay My Hat: The Best Of Paul Young. We also rant a bit about the music business, some of the cheap 6 to 10 track 'best of' collections previously/still being released and take a call from Vince.

item.title: EPISODE61 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: French post-punk/electronic act Buzz relaunched in 2006 and their new album Minimal & Electronique will be released this same day. This week we plan to feature an early track ("Kennedy") from the band as well as the title track, "Je Suis Avec Toi" and "East Village Radio (Dirty Sweet Project remix)" from the new disc.

item.title: EPISODE60 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: When we first started recording this show, we decided that Tony Carey would be a great artist to feature. An interview was scheduled early on but we never seemed to find the right time. So this week, we are going to feature him without the interview. The former Rainbow keyboardist had a string of solo hits in the 1980s. We will feature "A Fine, Fine Day" from his Live In Sweden 2006 Volume 1 album, "Why Me?" from his 1983 Planet P Project self-titled release and Planet P Project's "Join The Parade" from their recent album 1931: Go Out Dancing (Part 1). We also had an Australian caller before the end of the show.

item.title: EPISODE59 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: We will be featuring Boulder, Colorado, reggae-influenced rock/pop act The Samples this week showcasing the songs: "Birth Of Words," "Taking Us Home" and their cover of John Lennon's "Watching The Wheels." Of course, your regular dose of news, info and sarcasm.

item.title: EPISODE58 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: This week we feature Los Angeles' Plimsouls. Often overlooked when talking about 80s music, their 1983 album, Everywhere At Once, is essential for inclusion in your collection. We will feature the album's title track, "Oldest Story In The World" and their hit "A Million Miles Away."

item.title: EPISODE57 - Talking 80s Music with Martin Hennessy
item.author: an80snut@80smusiccentral.com
item.description: Lot of news this week but aside from our regular content we will celebrate the recently announced 25th anniversary reunion of Yazoo (or Yaz for those in the U.S.) We will discuss their brief history, lightly touch on their previous and recent projects and feature a hits mix as well as the songs "In My Room" and "Mr. Blue."

item.description: This week we feature the music of Michael Sembello. Remember him? He had that #1 hit "Maniac" from the Flashdance soundtrack.
